page.title: 03Warslow Schools
page.content: There are two schools in Warslow, a First School and a Middle School. Both schools are housed in the same building, which was first built and opened in 1958 as a Secondary School. It was changed into a Middle School in 1979 and the First School moved into the building in September 1980. In July 1985 there were 78 pupils in the Middle School with 8 full-time equivalent teachers. The number of pupils in the school is remaining steady. In July 1985 there were 69 pupils in the First School with 2.5 teachers. Here the number of pupils is rising. Most of the pupils travel to school by bus from the surrounding villages. They come from Flash, Longnor, Sheen, Hulme End, Alstonefield, Wetton, Butterton and Onecote.
